attributes.action: investigate North Kesteven District Council's approval of planning application 08/1220 which will bring about the destruction of 47 trees, which are covered by protection orders, within the town's recreation ground to enable a link road to be built for a new supermarket.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It is our belief that in approving this link road, North Kesteven District Council are contravening the following policies:

National Planning Policy, PPS1

Local Policy, RST1 

and from their Local Plan:

*POLICY C5 - Effects upon amenities*

*POLICY C8 - Safeguarding allocated sites *

*POLICY RST1 - Protecting existing recreational open space and built sports
facilities *

*POLICY LW4 - Trees of significant amenity value *

These policies were put in place to protect the people of Sleaford and our
environment from developments such as the one NKDC has just passed.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "investigate North Kesteven District Council's approval of planning application 08/1220 which will bring about the destruction of 47 trees, which are covered by protection orders, within the town's recreation ground to enable a link road to be built for a new supermarket."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page20751
